title: Sub Question 1
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

1 point: per characteristic. Reference to the Latin and a translation/paraphrase required for each characteristic. The identification may be contained in the translation. Iucundum (pleasant) and perpetuum (everlasting). Inter nos is acceptable, provided the student expresses the idea of mutual relationship or exclusivity.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

Iucundum (pleasant) and perpetuum (everlasting). Inter nos is acceptable, provided the student expresses the idea of mutual relationship or exclusivity.

Student response earns one of the available points.

Student response earns two of the available points.

1 point: per characteristic. Reference to the Latin and a translation/paraphrase required for each characteristic. The identification may be contained in the translation. Iucundum (pleasant) and perpetuum (everlasting). Inter nos is acceptable, provided the student expresses the idea of mutual relationship or exclusivity.

title: Sub Question 2
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

1 point: per item. Both a Latin clause and a translation are required for each item. Minimal Latin underlined. Two possible answers: Di magni, facite ut vere promittere possit (Great gods, bring it about that she be able to promise truly); atque id sincere dicat et ex animo (and that she say it sincerely and from the heart). In the second answer, either sincere dicat or dicat ex animo is sufficient. The request that the gods cause this to happen must be expressed or clearly implied at least once in the response.

title: Sub Question 3
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

1 point: The entire line must be correct to receive credit.

Aside from elision and length, no other markings are necessary.

ātque īd sīncērē dīcǎt ět ēx ǎnǐmō
